intro: Boehmeria latifolia, commonly known as broadleaf nettle, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes many species of stinging nettles. The plant is characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves with serrated edges and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its fibrous stems have been used in traditional crafts and textiles due to their strength and durability.
